Detection¶

obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.get_dimensions_from_contour(img, cntr, kernel)[source]¶

Estimated obstacle dimensions from a contour

Parameters

  • img (numpy.uint8) – image representaion of depth frame

  • cntr (cv2.OutputArrayOfArrays) – OpenCV contour object

  • kernel (numpy.uint8) – kernel to use for mask erosion

Returns

Mask for obstacle image, bounding box of obstacle, x coordinate of bottom left corner of bounding box, y coording of bottom left corner of bounding box, length of bounding box, and height of bounding box

Examples

mask, box, x, y, obj_length, obj_height = get_dimensions_from_contour(img, cntr, kernel)
obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.get_ground_plane_roi(depth_frame, depth_cutoff, y_cutoff, roi_x, roi_y)[source]¶

Crops the depth frame and applies a circular mask to define the region of interest for ground plane estimation

Parameters

  • depth_frame (numpy.float32) – [424, 512] depth frame

  • depth_cutoff (float) – furthest depth to keep, Kinect loses accuracy beyond 4.5m

  • y_cutoff (int) – minimum height to keep, everything else set to zero

  • roi_x (int) – x coordinate of center of circular mask

  • roi_y (int) – y coordinate of center of circular mask

Returns

Cropped depth frame with only region of interest (preferably a rough estimate of the ground plane)

obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.get_obstacles_with_plane(depth_frame, color_frame, obstacle_list, thetas, phis, obstacle_id, num_planes=1, dist_thresh=0.2, memory=200, obstacle_lifetime=5, depth_cutoff=4500.0, y_cutoff=212, roi_x=256, roi_y=320, send_data=False, visualize=False, save_frames=False)[source]¶

Main obstacle detection function. Performs full cycle of algorithm on a single depth frame, updates the obstacle list, and optionally visualizes the detected obstacles in real-time, publishes the obstacle data to the obstacleDetection topic, or save the visualizations for viewing (generally used when running the algorithm on the robot during testing)

Parameters

  • depth_frame (numpy.float32) – [424, 512] depth frame of meter values

  • color_frame – (numpy.uint8) : [424, 512] RGB image representation of Kinect color data overlayed on the depth frame

  • obstacle_list (list of Obstacle) – list of currently detected obstacles in memory

  • thetas (list of float) – list of Kinect elevation values currently in memory

  • phis (list of float) – list of Kinect azimuth values currently in memory

  • obstacle_id (int) – current maximum obstacle ID reached, ensures unique IDs

  • num_planes (int) – number of ground plane estimates to average over

  • dist_thresh (float) – maximum distance from the ground plane in meters

  • memory (int) – memory: number of orientations to hold in memory at a time

  • obstacle_lifetime (int) – default lifetime for newly detected obstacles

  • depth_cutoff (float) – furthest depth to keep, Kinect loses accuracy beyond 4.5m

  • y_cutoff (int) – minimum height to keep, everything else set to zero

  • roi_x (int) – x coordinate of center of circular mask

  • roi_y (int) – y coordinate of center of circular mask

  • send_data (bool) – boolean value specifying if detected obstacles should be published to the obstacleDetection topic

  • visualize (bool) – boolean value specifying if obstacle detection should be visualized by displaying the result

  • drawing the bounding box and measured values on each obstacle (of) –

  • save_frames (bool) – boolean value specifying if detected obstacle visualizations should be saved to the disk

Returns

[424, 512] Numpy array showing the locations of all detected obstacles (used for validation with labeled data)

obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.orient_point_cloud_to_ground_plane(xyz_arr, roi_point_cloud, thetas, phis, num_points, num_planes, memory)[source]¶

Computes the estimated ground plane and orients the point cloud coordinate system to have that plane be the XZ plane

Parameters

  • xyz_arr (numpy.float32) – 3D point cloud of the entire depth frame represented as an [N, 3] Numpy array

  • roi_point_cloud (numpy.float32) – 3D point cloud of cropped ROI represented as an [N, 3] Numpy array which is used to estimate the ground plane

  • thetas (list of float) – list of Kinect elevation values currently in memory

  • phis (list of float) – list of Kinect azimuth values currently in memory

  • num_points (int) – number of points to consider in estimating each ground plane

  • num_planes (int) – number of ground plane estimates to average over

  • memory (int) – number of orientations to hold in memory at a time

Returns

Re-oriented point cloud, ROI point cloud, and center of the ground plane estimate

Examples

xyz_arr, roi_point_cloud, center = orient_point_cloud_to_ground_plane(xyz_arr, roi_point_cloud, thetas, phis, num_points, num_planes, memory)
obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.process_obstacle(color, cx, cy, box, x, y, obj_length, obj_height, obj_depth, equi_diameter, obstacle_list, obstacle_lifetime, obstacle_id, visualize, send_data)[source]¶

Consider each possible obstacle and decide if it meets the criteria for detection and data publishing. Optionally displays visualizations of the algorithm in real-time and publishes obstacle data using ROS.

Parameters

  • color (numpy.uint8) – uint8 RGB image representation of depth frame used to visualize detected obstacles

  • cx (int) – estimated x coordinate of the center of obstacle in depth frame

  • cy (int) – estimated y coordinate of the center of obstacle in depth frame

  • box (cv2.RotatedRect) – bounding box of obstacle

  • x (int) – x coordinate of bottom left corner of bounding box

  • y (int) – y coordinate of bottom left corner of bounding box

  • obj_length (int) – length of bounding box in pixels

  • obj_height (int) – height of bounding box in pixels

  • obj_depth (float) – estimated depth (z coordinate) of bounding box area in original depth frame in millimeters

  • equi_diameter (int) – estimated obstacle diameter in pixels

  • obstacle_list (list of Obstacle) – list of currently detected obstacles in memory

  • obstacle_lifetime (int) – default lifetime for newly detected obstacles

  • obstacle_id (int) – current maximum obstacle ID reached, ensures unique IDs

  • visualize (bool) – boolean value specifying if obstacle detection should be visualized by displaying the result

  • drawing the bounding box and measured values on each obstacle (of) –

  • send_data (bool) – boolean value specifying if detected obstacles should be published to the obstacleDetection topic

obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.project_plane_to_2d(xyz_arr, img, center, dist_thresh)[source]¶

Removes all points above some threshold of the estimated ground plane and projects the remaining points back to 2D

Parameters

  • xyz_arr (numpy.float32) – 3D point cloud represented as an [N, 3] Numpy array

  • img (numpy.uint8) – image representaion of depth frame

  • center (numpy.float32) – XYZ coordinate of center of ground plane

  • dist_thresh (float) – maximum distance from the ground plane in meters

Returns

Image representation of depth frame containing only the potential obstacle points

obstacle_detection.include.obstacle_detection.remove_dead_obstacles(obstacle_list)[source]¶

Checks the lifetimes of all obstacles currently in memory to see if any have died. If any obstacles have reached a lifetime of zero (meaning they have been absent from obstacle_lifetime frames) they are removed from the obstacle list

Parameters

obstacle_list (list of Obstacle) – list of currently detected obstacles in memory
